jobs.title: Full Stack Engineer - DSS (Remote)
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

As a full stack developer in the Dataiku engineering team, you will play a crucial role in helping us have a real impact on the daily life of data analysts and scientists. You will be joining one of 3 teams that develop new features and improve existing parts of  Data Science Studio (DSS) based on user feedback.

DSS is an on-premises application that connects together all big data technologies. We work with SQL databases, Spark, Kubernetes, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, MLlib, scikit-learn, Shiny, … and many more. Basically, our technological stack is made of all the technologies present in Technoslavia!

Our backend is mainly written in Java but also includes large chunks in Scala, Python and R. Our frontend is based on Angular and also makes vast usage of d3.js.

One of the most unique characteristics of DSS is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to data analysts (with visual and easy to use analytics) and data scientists (with deep integration in code and libraries, and a web-based IDE).

This is a full-time position, based in France either in our Paris office or remote.


Your missions
- Turn ideas or simplistic specifications into full-fledged product features, including unit and end-to-end tests.
- Tackle complex problems that range from performance and scalability to usability, so that complicated machineries look straightforward and simple to use for our users.
- Help your coworkers: review code, spread your technical expertise, improve our tool chain
- Bring your energy to the team!


You are the ideal recruit if
- You are mastering a programming language (Java, C#, Python, Javascript, You-name-it, ...).
- You know that low-level Java code and slick web applications in Javascript are two sides of the same coin and are eager to use both.
- You know that ACID is not a chemistry term.
- You have a first experience (either professional or personal) building a real product or working with big data or cloud technologies.


Hiring process
- Initial call with the talent acquisition manager
- On-site meeting (or video call) with the hiring manager
- Home test to show your skills
- Final on-site interviews





To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

As a full stack developer in the Dataiku engineering team, you will play a crucial role in helping us have a real impact on the daily life of data analysts and scientists. You will be joining one of 3 teams that develop new features and improve existing parts of Data Science Studio (DSS) based on user feedback.

DSS is an on-premises application that connects together all big data technologies. We work with SQL databases, Spark, Kubernetes, Hadoop, Elasticsearch, MLlib, scikit-learn, Shiny, … and many more. Basically, our technological stack is made of all the technologies present in Technoslavia!

Our backend is mainly written in Java but also includes large chunks in Scala, Python and R. Our frontend is based on Angular and also makes vast usage of d3.js.

One of the most unique characteristics of DSS is the breadth of its scope and the fact that it caters both to data analysts (with visual and easy to use analytics) and data scientists (with deep integration in code and libraries, and a web-based IDE).

This is a full-time position, based in France either in our Paris office or remote.

Your missions

  • Turn ideas or simplistic specifications into full-fledged product features, including unit and end-to-end tests.
  • Tackle complex problems that range from performance and scalability to usability, so that complicated machineries look straightforward and simple to use for our users.
  • Help your coworkers: review code, spread your technical expertise, improve our tool chain
  • Bring your energy to the team!

You are the ideal recruit if

  • You are mastering a programming language (Java, C#, Python, Javascript, You-name-it, ...).
  • You know that low-level Java code and slick web applications in Javascript are two sides of the same coin and are eager to use both.
  • You know that ACID is not a chemistry term.
  • You have a first experience (either professional or personal) building a real product or working with big data or cloud technologies.

Hiring process

  • Initial call with the talent acquisition manager
  • On-site meeting (or video call) with the hiring manager
  • Home test to show your skills
  • Final on-site interviews

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Full stack Engineer
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

As a full stack engineer in the Dataiku engineering team, you will play a crucial role in developing new features from scratch and improving existing ones. You will be joining one of 6 teams that work on our main product Data Science Studio (DSS) or our new one, Governance Hub (GH). 

DSS is an end to end and collaborative data analytics platform having a real impact on the daily life of data analysts and scientists. It connects together all big data technologies and includes machine learning models.  GH is an application that monitors and manages data initiatives across the various departments of a company. It ensures that good practices and governance rules are enforced. It is fully customizable to fit policies and processes of the company.

Join Dataiku to be part of a passionate and highly qualified developers team working with the Big Data and Data Science technologies (Kubernetes, Docker, Hadoop, Azure, GCP, AWS, Scala, Python, TensorFlow)!


RESPONSIBILITIES
- Turn ideas or simplistic specifications into full-fledged product features, including unit and end-to-end tests.
- Tackle complex problems that range from performance and scalability to usability, so that complicated machineries look straightforward and simple to use for our users.
- Help your coworkers: review code, spread your technical expertise, improve our tool chainBring your energy to the team!

- You are mastering a programming language (Java, C#, Python, Javascript, You-name-it, ...).
- You know that low-level Java code and slick web applications in Javascript are two sides of the same coin and are eager to use both.
- You are not surprised that “[Math.max](http://Math.max)()\

- Initial call with the talent acquisition manager

jobs.title: Full stack engineer - GH
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

As a full stack developer in the Dataiku engineering team, focusing on Governance Hub (GH), you will play a crucial role in helping us bootstrapping this new product.

GH is an application that monitor and manage data initiatives across the various departments of a company. It ensures that good practices and governance rules are enforced. It is fully customizable to fit policies and processes of the company.

Our backend is mainly written in Java and the storage layer uses PostgreSQL 12. Our frontend is based on the latest version of Angular.

One of the most unique characteristics of GH is its fully-custom model and a strong integration with numerous external tools (project management, visualization, data science, etc.). This makes it interesting and challenging to design and develop such a software.

This is a full-time position, based in France either in our Paris office or remote.


RESPONSIBILITES
- Turn ideas or simplistic specifications into full-fledged product features, including unit and end-to-end tests.
- Tackle complex problems that range from performance and scalability to usability, so that complicated machineries look straightforward and simple to use for our users.
- Help your coworkers: review code, spread your technical expertise, improve our tool chain
- Bring your energy to the team!

- You are not surprised that “[Math.max](http://Math.max)()\

- Initial call with the talent acquisition manager

jobs.title: Global Customer Success Manager
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

The Dataiku Global Customer Success Manager is responsible for serving 1-2  large enterprise accounts with locations throughout the world. This position proactively works with a broad set of stakeholders to illustrate the value delivered through Dataiku’s software & services. The Global Customer Success Manager serves as the internal voice of the customer while working with other Dataiku teams and partners around the world to exceed customer expectations. This individual's performance is based on specific metrics associated with customer software adoption, customer satisfaction, revenue growth and retention.


Key Responsibilities:
- Actively serve 1-2 global accounts including some of the world’s leading organizations in industries such as financial services, insurance, pharmaceuticals, transportation, manufacturing & technology.
- Gain an understanding of client’s use cases and desired business outcomes and help hundreds of licensed users achieve these goals via Dataiku’s Data Science Studio (DSS) & Services.
- Help clients translate the business use cases they’re trying to crack into data science solutions.
- Understand the client’s strategic vision and align with Dataiku’s roadmap to achieve these goals.
- Partner with Dataiku Implementation Managers & Data Scientists to ensure successful deployment and engagement with DSS.
- Provide guidance to customer organizations on how to leverage DSS to implement data science projects from design to production.
- Implement customer engagement strategies including consistent Value Reviews & Joint Success Plans.
- Leverage Customer Health analytics to identify customer upsell opportunities & churn risks.
- Collaborate with Dataiku’s Sales team to expand customer relationships & ensure renewals.
- Effectively solve ad-hoc customer issues as needed, interacting with Customer Support, escalating customer issues as needed and identifying solutions/resources.Collaborate with Marketing to grow library of customer testimonials.
- Build strong account level relationships with Technology & Consulting partners.
- Inform customers of Dataiku’s Product roadmap & provide continuous customer feedback to Dataiku’s Product team.
- Stay current customers on Dataiku’s products, competitive landscape & data science trends.
- Embrace & contribute to Customer Success team methodologies.


Core Skills & Talents:
- Passion for serving large organizations and for data science.
- Strong verbal/written communication & presentation skills; extraordinary listening skills.
- Comfort establishing credibility with senior decision makers & influencers.
- Ease in speaking to stakeholders at all levels and various departments: from business executives to data scientists, analysts and IT.
- Strong problem solving & analytical skills; formulate solutions that deliver real business value.
- Ability to recognize & maximize new business opportunities
- Well organized; handle multiple accounts & assignments simultaneously.
- A commitment to exceed goals that is internal, constant & self-imposed.


Qualifications:
- B.S. or B.A. in business management, finance, economics, data science or similar study. MBA, Masters in Computer Science or similar degree preferred.
- Demonstrated experience with enterprise analytics/data science.  
- Working knowledge of Big Data technologies, databases and cloud services.  
- Understand enterprise software platform architecture and strategies.
- Demonstrated experience with enterprise advanced analytics/data science.  
- Working knowledge of databases and big data technologies such as Hadoop & Spark preferred.  Validated results in prior role.
- 10-15 years of prior account management, customer success, consulting experience, preferably within enterprise software or data science.
- Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.


Expected Outcomes:
- Increased depth & breadth of product adoption across customer accounts.
- Identification of additional revenue opportunities for Dataiku Sales team.
- High revenue retention with limited churn & downsells.
- Verifiable customer proof points, references and case studies across customer portfolio.
- High NPS & Customer Satisfaction scores.


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

- Strong problem solving & analytical skills; formulate solutions that deliver real business value.
- Ability to recognize & maximize new business opportunities
- Well organized; handle multiple accounts & assignments simultaneously.
- A commitment to exceed goals that is internal, constant & self-imposed.


Qualifications:
- B.S. or B.A. in business management, finance, economics, data science or similar study. MBA, Masters in Computer Science or similar degree preferred.
- Demonstrated experience with enterprise analytics/data science.  
- Working knowledge of Big Data technologies, databases and cloud services.  
- Understand enterprise software platform architecture and strategies.
- Demonstrated experience with enterprise advanced analytics/data science.  
- Working knowledge of databases and big data technologies such as Hadoop & Spark preferred.  Validated results in prior role.
- 10-15 years of prior account management, customer success, consulting experience, preferably within enterprise software or data science.
- Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.


Expected Outcomes:
- Increased depth & breadth of product adoption across customer accounts.
- Identification of additional revenue opportunities for Dataiku Sales team.
- High revenue retention with limited churn & downsells.
- Verifiable customer proof points, references and case studies across customer portfolio.
- High NPS & Customer Satisfaction scores.


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Global Tax Manager
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more.

But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Located in either NYC or Paris and reporting into the Corporate Controller, Dataiku is looking for its first ever dedicated tax specialist as it builds out its global finance and accounting teams.

To support the growing needs of our growing company -- like going from 400 to 625 people in 2020! -- we’re seeking a generalist tax professional (with strong international tax experience) to help us with various strategic and tactical tax issues across all geographies.

As our first tax hire, there's nothing related to tax that you won’t have an impact on! That means tax planning, legal structuring, income tax, sales tax, VAT, transfer pricing, new entity creation, and much more.

This is a great opportunity for the right person to own and build a rapidly growing international company’s tax function from inception.


Responsibilities:
- Coordinate all aspects of US and non-US tax compliance, such as preparing tax return workpapers, reviewing tax returns prepared by tax advisors, processing tax payments and responding to audit inquiries
- Participate in international tax structuring efforts, such as considering when and if to transfer ownership of IP to existing or to-be-created Dataiku legal entities, with external tax advisors
- Coordinate the preparation of the US tax provision and related financial statement footnotes with external tax advisors
- Understand tax requirements for new countries Dataiku enters and support the creation of new entities as needed
- Assist outside tax advisors in the preparation of various federal, state, local and non-US tax forms
- Participate in transfer pricing analysis efforts and documentation requirements, including country-by-country reporting with external tax providers
- Participate in the month-end close processes
- Evaluate and make recommendations regarding various tax law and regulations, including international, federal, and state tax law·        Assist in performing due diligence for acquisitions, tax audits and other tax reporting
- Ensure compliance with FATCA, including the annual FBAR filing for US employees
- Assist with the filing for R&D tax credits in France
- Participate in the implementation of Netsuite and lead the implementation of Avalara


Qualifications:
- CPA or equivalent preferred
- 8+ years tax experience, ideally both in-house and public accounting experience
- Ability to achieve results in a fast-paced, high-growth, global environment
- Proven ability to diagnose problems using critical thinking skills and drive appropriate solutions
- Demonstrable ability to practice a high level of confidentiality
- Able to handle projects with minimal oversight in a fast-paced environment with multiple and sometimes changing priorities
- Able to work both on a team (as member and / or leader) and independently to deliver results
- Project management and leadership competencies such as self-motivation, time management and organizational skills, attention to detail, adaptability, flexibility, and drive


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ) and to our annual company-wide offsite
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more.

But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Located in either NYC or Paris and reporting into the Corporate Controller, Dataiku is looking for its first ever dedicated tax specialist as it builds out its global finance and accounting teams.

To support the growing needs of our growing company -- like going from 400 to 625 people in 2020! -- we’re seeking a generalist tax professional (with strong international tax experience) to help us with various strategic and tactical tax issues across all geographies.

As our first tax hire, there's nothing related to tax that you won’t have an impact on! That means tax planning, legal structuring, income tax, sales tax, VAT, transfer pricing, new entity creation, and much more.

This is a great opportunity for the right person to own and build a rapidly growing international company’s tax function from inception.

Responsibilities:

  • Coordinate all aspects of US and non-US tax compliance, such as preparing tax return workpapers, reviewing tax returns prepared by tax advisors, processing tax payments and responding to audit inquiries
  • Participate in international tax structuring efforts, such as considering when and if to transfer ownership of IP to existing or to-be-created Dataiku legal entities, with external tax advisors
  • Coordinate the preparation of the US tax provision and related financial statement footnotes with external tax advisors
  • Understand tax requirements for new countries Dataiku enters and support the creation of new entities as needed
  • Assist outside tax advisors in the preparation of various federal, state, local and non-US tax forms
  • Participate in transfer pricing analysis efforts and documentation requirements, including country-by-country reporting with external tax providers
  • Participate in the month-end close processes
  • Evaluate and make recommendations regarding various tax law and regulations, including international, federal, and state tax law· Assist in performing due diligence for acquisitions, tax audits and other tax reporting
  • Ensure compliance with FATCA, including the annual FBAR filing for US employees
  • Assist with the filing for R&D tax credits in France
  • Participate in the implementation of Netsuite and lead the implementation of Avalara

Qualifications:

  • CPA or equivalent preferred
  • 8+ years tax experience, ideally both in-house and public accounting experience
  • Ability to achieve results in a fast-paced, high-growth, global environment
  • Proven ability to diagnose problems using critical thinking skills and drive appropriate solutions
  • Demonstrable ability to practice a high level of confidentiality
  • Able to handle projects with minimal oversight in a fast-paced environment with multiple and sometimes changing priorities
  • Able to work both on a team (as member and / or leader) and independently to deliver results
  • Project management and leadership competencies such as self-motivation, time management and organizational skills, attention to detail, adaptability, flexibility, and drive

Benefits:

  • Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
  • Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
  • Trips to Paris (our European HQ) and to our annual company-wide offsite
  • Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
  • Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: HR Business Partner UK
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

The HR Business Partner UK will join our European team to take over all People related topics for our London office. Reporting to the Director HRBP based in Paris, you will partner and coach team members to empower  them in their roles, be it as individual contributors or managers. 

The successful candidate will be in a position to ensure compliance in  all HR admin operations in the UK, while partnering with managers to ensure team continuous engagement and performance. This candidate will also act as a true team player and work in close coordination with the People team in Paris and in New York to contribute and roll out all HR processes and projects. 


What You'll Do
- Support managers as a business partner in their team management
- Provide support and coaching in employee development 
- Implement and facilitate the adoption of HR tools and processes (skill matrix, performance assessment, compensation reviews,...)
- Manage employee relations and grievance cases and provide guidance towards conflict resolution
- Partner with our VP Sales based in London to engage employees and boost team spirit
- Ensure our compliance with UK laws and applicable regulations (statutory documents, employee files, etc. )
- Oversee payroll & employee benefits
- Ensure safe, welcoming and enabling work environment with the help of an Office Manager


Who You Are
- Master's degree in Human Resource Management and/or Labour Law. 
- 3+ years of HR experience incl. previous successful experience in a business partner position
- Willingness to dive in and provide proactive support to managers 
- Excellent communication skills 
- Discretion of highly sensitive information
- Sound knowledge of the UK legal, social and tax frameworks
- Proficiency with employee relations, managing ER and grievance cases 


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: HR Manager (APAC)
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We are looking for an HR Manager to oversee HR operations in the APAC region. You will report directly to our Director HRBP based in Paris.  This role focuses on ensuring the smooth execution of all HR processes for our employees, starting right after the onboarding. 
This role will be based in the company’s office in Singapore and will include travels to other Dataiku locations in the area (mainly Australia for the time being).

The successful candidate will be interested in working in the HR field and has worked as an HR generalist or HR administrator, ideally in a fast-paced and international company. We are looking for a dynamic, detail-oriented partner who can help us champion Dataiku in the APAC region. This candidate will be an integral part of the HR team yet should feel comfortable working autonomously.


What You'll Do
- **HR Operations: **
Be the first point of contact for general HR queries from managers and employees in the APAC regionSupport and manage HR processes (onboarding, off-boarding, employee life-cycle processes etc.): including laptops purchase & set upPreparation of HR documentation (employment letters, immigration, contracts etc.)- **Payroll & Admin**
Run payroll and oversee benefitsAudit and improve - if need be - all benefits scheme for the regions (health insurance, pension, etc)Facilitate international mobilities by coordinating relocation locally with our providers according to the company policy (including but not limited to  immigration and tax topics)- **HR projects**
As the local HR representative and as part of the global HR team, you will play an active role in transversal HR projects (career paths, campus management, etc.. )

Who You Are
- 4+  years of experience in HR ops or admin, ideally in a international company
- Previous successful experience working with remote management
- Willingness to dive in and assist with whatever is needed 
- Detail-oriented with strong analytical, evaluative, and research skills
- Polished and professional interpersonal communication, writing, and presentation skills.
- Discretion around highly sensitive information, e.g. salary and benefit information
- Previous experience in a fast paced environment a plus


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Head of Accounts Payable
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for a Head of Accounts Payable to join our growing Finance team in our Paris office. Along with responsibility fo ongoing AP processes, this person will be responsible for taking the lead on developing and evolving our AP systems and processes to ensure that they are efficient and scalable as our business continues to grow. This role will oversee vendor maintenance, compliance, AP performance management and analytics. The person in this role will be responsible for global service delivery in all regions including the Americas, EMEA, and Asia Pacific. This person will report to the Regional Accounting Manager – EMEA.




Vendor-related
- Ensuring new vendors are added in compliance with the Company’s policy
- Entering invoices into Netsuite
- Monitoring status of purchase orders and invoices in the PO and A/P modules
- Ensuring that invoices are approved in accordance with company policy
- Lead the procure-to-pay automation
- Ensuring that invoices are correctly coded using the Company’s chart of accounts
- Ensuring critical vendors are paid on a timely basis
- Ensuring that all available vendor discounts are taken
- Managing the approval workflow in the PO and A/P modules
- Define and maintain AP policies
- Maintain calendars related to payments and payment communications
- Validate and report on performance metrics
- Define and maintain AP reporting inventory
- Manage and support payment activities of AP team
- Make vendor disbursements through Netsuite
- Respond to payment inquiries from vendors


Employee-related
- Monitoring status of T&E reports in the T&E application
- Performing final review of all T&E reports to ensure conformity with the T&E policy
- Ensuring timely reimbursements are made to employees
- Perform administrative functions in the T&E application in coordination with the Controller


Other
- Managing the coding and payment of all purchasing cards and company credit cards
- Coordinating with the GL accountants during the monthly close process
- Recommending best practices and considering automation and process improvements
- Responding to all A/P-related inquiries
- Be responsible for the collection and filing of all vendor W-9’s and annual processing of 1099’s.
- Coordinating tax filings with the Tax function
- Supporting annual financial statement audit process
- Perform month-end AP closing duties, including journal entries and reconciliations
- Have a deep understanding of accounting and general ledger coding
- Seek continuous improvement and efficiency opportunities to improve the speed and effectiveness of payment activities
- Partner with various internal departments to implement processes and policies that contribute to accurate payment and accounting
- Perform other duties or projects as assigned


Who You Are
- Bachelor’s degree or an equivalent combination of education and experience
- 9-10 years of accounts payable experience including 3-4 years of T&E processing utilizing a web-based T&E application (e.g. Expensify, Concur, etc.)
- Willingness to extend themselves and assist other people
- Strong understanding of financial controls around Purchasing and A/P
- Good planning and organizational skills to balance and prioritize work
- Experience and competency working with Excel
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skillsAdvanced knowledge of Excel (V lookup, Pivot table, etc.)
- High degree of accuracy, strong attention to detail and problem-solving skills
- Ability to work independently and proactively, as well as a collaborator on a team
- Strong interpersonal and communication skills
- Willing to take on additional responsibilities and grow the team
  
**Nice-to-have** - Prior start-up experience
- Prior Netsuite and Expensify experience
- Prior experience with a software development company
- Prior experience with system implementations
- Exposure to a SOX environment
- Exposure to large ERP systems


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Implementation Manager - Germany
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for an Implementation Manager to join the team. The ideal candidate is an energetic individual who is passionate about using data science to solve business problems and deploying big data technologies, and who will efficiently help customers drive their projects to get the most out of Dataiku DSS.

As a part of the Customer team, the Implementation Manager is responsible for driving smooth client roll out of our product.


Responsibilities
- Effectively project-manage the delivery to our clients of Dataiku’s suite of professional services: such services include assisted software installation, customer training/coaching, and co-development of data science projects with our customers
- Maintain consistent and concise internal communication across multiple teams
- Build and maintain relationships with key partners, both within Dataiku and among our customers
- Ensure customer satisfaction throughout the implementation process
- Contribute to the standardization of our implementation processes while Dataiku continues our rapid growth
- Set up our customers for success using Dataiku from day one
  
Your skilled coordination of their deployment, training, and adoption of best practices will position them to derive the maximum value from the software, contributing to their data-driven operational success.

Requirements
- Demonstrated project  management skills in a complex context including: leadership, communication, customer management
- An interest in staying up to date on the latest techniques surrounding data, big data and data science (Python, R, Scala, Hadoop, Spark, H2O, SQL…)
- You must have a general knowledge and understanding of IT, with a will to learn more
- Experience in enterprise data projects and familiarity with advanced analytics technologies is a plus
- Organized, process-oriented, able to work in autonomy, and resourceful
- Motivation to learn data science and AI concepts and applications. Knowledge of data science is a plus
- Experience providing customer training is a plus
- Bachelor’s degree required
- 3 years + of experience in customer facing and/or project management in a technical context
- Native or professional level in German


Benefits
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company 
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team 
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness 
  
Dataiku processes your data for recruitment purposes only. We store these data in our Applicant Tracking System, Lever, which is fully compliant with EU data protection laws, and we will not share it with anyone else. You will find information about our compliance with GDPR on our website.




To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Lead Generation Manager
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

After our growth and expansion in 2019, we continue to forge ahead on our Inside Sales team with the hiring of a brand new role for a team lead and people manager in Singapore. The Lead Generation Manager will oversee a team of 3-5 Sales Development Reps and Business Development Specialists, supporting the Singapore territory. Reporting directly into the Director of Inside Sales, this person will collaborate with their counterparts in New York and Denver, as well as closely with Sales and Marketing, helping to inspire, grow, and better their team.


Responsibilities
- Manage a team ranging in size from 3 to 5 of Sales Development Representatives (SDR) & Business Development Representatives (BDR) 
- Coach through Sales Development process: review lead qualification, manage lead nurturing
- Drive one-on-one’s with reporting and tooling; manage with metrics 
- Join discovery calls to offer real time feedback
- Optimize a scalable on-boarding and development infrastructure for Sales Development Representatives in order to minimize their ramp time
- Drive coaching/one-on-one’s with reporting and tooling; manage with metrics 
- Report monthly / quarterly / yearly on sales metrics and achievements
- Refine the lead gen pitch and process to achieve optimum results
- Partner with Account Executives and marketing to generate new business pipeline
- Oversee usage of team systems including SalesForce, Outreach, Sales Navigator and additional tools. 
- Help create a fun, high energy environment where people love coming to work


Requirements
- 2+ years managing a Lead Generation team
- Previous Inbound and Outbound Lead Generation experience
- Proven track record of Lead Gen goal attainment
- Hands on experience with CRM software
- Excellent interpersonal and team management skills
- Strong analytical and organizational skills
- Comfortable with ambiguity and ability to thrive in fast-pace environment
- Interest in Data Science a plus! 


Benefits
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. Responsibilities
- Generate new qualified opportunities and pipeline for the Field Sales Team through Outbound Lead Generation
- Manage the Business Development Representative (BDR) team for France
- Hired new team members (100% growth of the team)
- Onboard and coach
- Develop sales skills

- Help create a fun, high energy environment where people love coming to work

- Hands on experience with CRM software
- In-depth understanding of the sales administration process
- Excellent interpersonal and team management skills
- Strong analytical and organizational skills
- Numerical abilities and problem-solving attitude
- Outbound sales engagements
- Refine the sales pitch and process to achieve optimum results
- Establish metrics and help the team improve by understanding their performance
- Oversee usage of team systems including SalesForce and HubSpot
- Work with Account Executives and marketing to generate new business pipeline
- French & English

jobs.title: Learning & Development Coordinator
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We are looking for an innovative and people-oriented professional with learning & development experience to join a new global team tasked with enhancing the learning experience for Dataiku employees at scale.
This position covers the coordination, delivery, and logistics of development programs and initiatives from a local to a global level. 



What You'll Do
- Schedule training events and coordinate logistics with office managers (internal communication, venue, presenters, supplies, and materials), both globally and regionally.
- Support the implementation of a new LMS (Skilljar)
- Manage programs and participants through this LMS
- Contribute to the creation & roll-out of internal programs in collaboration with stakeholders from other departments
- Facilitate workshops and learning events 
- Instructional design: support the creation of learning materials & content using the Google Suite, video editing software, eLearning authoring tools, and other multimedia technologies 
- Develop, track and report metrics to assess learning success and overall impact


Who You Are
- Experience planning and coordinating meetings or events.
- Experience being highly organized and detail-oriented in managing multiple priorities and meeting deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
- Strong team work and interpersonal skills & ability to operate in a multicultural environment. 
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and French
- Expresses thoughts, feelings, and ideas in a clear manner in both individual and group situations; demonstrates active listening
- Creates clear written communication
- Genuine interest in enabling other people for success
- Demonstrates initiative and resourcefulness in independent problem solving
- Solid self-management skills including planning work, using time well, and doing whatever it takes to deliver reliable results.
- Tech savvy and you like to learn!


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Legal Counsel
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is hiring a Legal Counsel to join our passionate legal team to support healthy growth of the company. This position will be based in our New York office, but we are open to candidates from other states willing to relocate.


Responsibilities:
- Negotiate software license agreements, partnership agreements, professional services agreements, NDAs and other high impact commercial agreements, collaborating with revenue generating and technical teams in the Americas
- Be a thought partner, providing practical guidance related to data privacy, security, IP and other business needs during the deal process
- Assist with implementation of internal process improvements and contract management
- Work with all teams on vendor agreements
- Other responsibilities as needed


Requirements:
- J.D. degree from an A.B.A. accredited law school; admitted and member in good standing with the bar
- 2-4 years of law firm and/or in-house experience; experience with software sales or license agreements preferred
- Good business judgment combined with strong verbal and written communication skills
- Highly organized, experienced with managing numerous deals simultaneously and able to adapt to shifting priorities
- Thrives in a fast-paced and collaborative environment


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness

Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Marketing Associate
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We are looking for a Marketing Associate to help with our marketing campaign strategy and execution starting in 2020. Located in London, you will directly report to the EMEA Marketing Director. Your role will be to participate in the definition and execution of all our different marketing activities.


Your main responsibilities will be
- Co-designing marketing campaigns and identifying potential go-to-market strategies for the Nordics/Netherlands:
Specific industry targetingPersona-based campaignsGeo-based campaignsRun VIP program for specific target accountsCoordinate ABM campaigns in the Nordics/NL area  
- Managing events in Nordics/NL
Running Meetups with the data science communityCoordinating third-party eventsLeading Proprietary events execution in Nordics/NL

Requirements
- English proficiency. Dutch or Nordic language a plus.
- Ability to work successfully with sales, SDRs, BDRs, CSMs, Partners… And more!
- Self motivated with demonstrated flexibility and adaptability in a fast-paced and constantly evolving work environment
- Some experience in the marketing field, startups, or business development
- Experience with Salesforce, Hubspot, Pardot or Marketo is a plus
- Strong inclination towards innovative technologies like Big Data and Predictive analysis
  
You are our ideal candidate if you: - Work well with extremely smart engineers, designers, sales managers, and, of course, marketers
- Already know the wonders of Dataiku DSS, Hubspot, Active Campaign, HTML, CSS, SQL, Python, and, eventually, the Microsoft Office Suite
- Aren't afraid to learn all about Hadoop, Spark, Scala, overfitting, and Gradient Boosting Trees
- Don't care too much about your weight (Breakfast, Data Beers, and chouquettes available all year-long)
- Are ambitious, smart, quick and have a great sense of initiative


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Office Manager - UK
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

The Office Manager will work closely with all teams in our London office to ensure employees enjoy working in a safe, welcoming and facilitating environment. 

The Office Manager will report to our HRBP Director, and locally to our Sales Director UK. 

We are looking for a dynamic, detail-oriented partner who can help us most efficiently run the London office and facilitate the work of our teams. Teamwork will be an integral part of this role, as the candidate will be encouraged to take an active part in bigger projects in coordination with other office teams in Paris and New York. 


What You'll Do 
- Organize daily office life: errands, shopping and supplies (food, stationery, etc), organize lunches and events, prepare meeting rooms, small maintenance; be the point of contact for house managers
- Organize spot-on or recurrent events for the team and the company (team days, lunches, networking events…)
- Management of the office life budget
- Onboarding liaison with Paris, our European HQ, for new employees
- Welcome and support visitors, manage incoming calls and requests
- Coordinate with IT for technology management, including laptops set-up
- Support the London team in admin tasks (e.g. work trips organization, customers’ visits, visas, etc. )


Who You Are
- Successful experience working in an environment requiring flexibility and proactivity.
- Willingness to dive in and assist with whatever is needed 
- Detail-oriented and getting things done spirit
- Time-management skills, ability to multi-task and prioritize
- Polished and professional interpersonal communication, writing, and presentation skills.
- Proficient in Microsoft Office and Google Suite
- Discretion around highly sensitive information


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Partner Manager - South Europe
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for a Partner Manager - South Europe to join our Alliances organisation. Since the launch of our company, we have experienced healthy growth and steady market demand. This is a new position due to business expansion, with responsibility for an already existing set of partners and with the objective of forming new Alliances. We are simply looking to expand on our early momentum with partners.

We’re looking for someone who can express passion about the new technologies and possibilities of Big Data and Advanced Analytics and who can tie the value of ‘Data Science Studio’ (DSS) to the offer of our partners, both from product and GTM standpoints.

The role consists of engaging with partners at a corporate level and also to develop relationships in the field, to facilitate concrete partnering between Sales teams. The Partner Manager is responsible for those partners, while being able to leverage various company resources, to reach a successful collaboration with them.

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this early stage, the Partner Manager is likely to work cross functionally with Marketing, Product Management and Engineering.

This role is open for Paris or Madrid or Italy


REQUIREMENTS
- 5+ year experience in developing Alliances 
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills in  **Spanish and/or Italian** , and in **English **
- Strong belief in a customer centric selling philosophy and applying a consultative approach in customer/partner interactions 
- Background in positioning innovation and new concepts 
- Strong ability to develop a vision match with partners and to cultivate champions within those organizations
- Good articulation of competitive positioning 
- Travel to 30%



  





To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this early stage, the Partner Manager is likely to work cross functionally with Marketing, Product Management and Engineering.

This role is open for Paris or Madrid or Italy

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ year experience in developing Alliances
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in Spanish and/or Italian , and in *English *
  • Strong belief in a customer centric selling philosophy and applying a consultative approach in customer/partner interactions
  • Background in positioning innovation and new concepts
  • Strong ability to develop a vision match with partners and to cultivate champions within those organizations
  • Good articulation of competitive positioning
  • Travel to 30%

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Partner Manager, Australia & New Zealand
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku’s mission is big: to democratize data science throughout organizations around the world by bringing data analysts, engineers, and scientists together to deliver self-service analytics and operationalize machine learning.  It’s not just about technology and processes.  At Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for a Partner Manager based in Melbourne to join our Partnerships organization to manage partners in Australia and New Zealand. Since the launch of our company, we have experienced healthy growth and steady market demand. This is a new position due to rapid  business expansion.  The successful candidate will be responsible for managing existing partner relationships and forming new partnerships with organizations that can help us deliver successful joint solutions to our customers and grow our presence in the region.  

We’re looking for someone who can express passion about new technologies and the business benefits of AI and who can tie the value of  Dataiku Data Science Studio (DSS) to the offers of our partners, from both a product and GTM perspective.  The Partner Manager will engage with ecosystem partners - system integrators, consultants, value-added resellers and complementary technology partners - at the executive and field levels to develop solution offerings that deliver value for our joint customers. 

The Partner Manager is responsible for recruiting, onboarding, and enabling partners and managing go-to-market programs and field execution with our sales teams to exceed revenue targets and drive customer success. 
Dataiku is a fast-growing company with great momentum and the Partner Manager will need to work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Services, and other departments to drive sustainable company growth.


Qualifications:
- 5+ years experience in developing partnerships and revenue-generating partner relationships
- Experience in “data” – big data, analytics, data science, BI/DW, data integration, AI, etc.
- Strong belief in a customer-centric selling philosophy and applying a consultative approach in customer/partner interactionsBackground in positioning innovative solutions
- Strong ability to develop joint value propositions with partners and to cultivate champions within partner organizations
- Ability to articulate competitive positioning and differentiation
- Strong presentation, negotiation, and business planning skillsDesire to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment with the ability to adapt to change
- Travel up to 30%  


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Regional Accounting Manager - EMEA
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is seeking a Regional Accounting Manager to join our accounting and finance team in Paris.   The role will report into the Corporate Controller located in New York City.


Principal Duties And Responsibilities
-   
  
_Monthly Close and General Ledger Accounting_- Responsible for the monthly, quarterly, and year-end closing under US-GAAP and Statutory GAAP for the EMEA entities; currently France, UK, and UAE
- Manage and develop a team of 2 accountants
- Work with the tax function to ensure compliance with French Tax requirements (CVAE, CFE, tax return, VAT declarations and refund, CIT, customs declarations, Banque de France, INSEE, etc)
- Perform timely and accurate reviews of all balance sheet reconciliations
- Participate in the implementation of a global close management tool
- Work with the tax function on the implementation of updated transfer pricing studies and intercompany agreements
- Serve as the primary contact for all external auditors in EMEA
- Ensure close collaboration with the US finance team
- Work with tax function on calculating amounts for the French R&D tax credit programs
- Oversee the preparation and submission of the annual accounts in various countries within EMEA.
- Proactively review accounts to ensure all financial transactions are valid and recorded to ensure accuracy of reported data
- Review and/or record requested company cross-charges and manual journal entries including proper documentation
- Set up internal control procedures in conjunction with the US finance group
- Ensure correct valuation and completeness of all assets and liabilities 
  
  
_Accounts Payable_- Manage and develop the global Accounts Payable team of 2 employees
- Oversee the implementation of a vendor selection and onboarding process
- Oversee the implementation of an accounts payable management tool
- Oversee the disbursement of payments to vendors
- Manage cash requirements with the US finance team
- Ensure and maintain strict controls around expenditure inclusive of T&E.
- Oversee the reimbursement of employees for T&E expenses


Experience and Skills
- Degree in business administration, Accounting or equivalent.
- Accounting qualification: DSCG, with ideally an experience within a firm
- A total of 10+ years of experience which includes strong experience in international companies, audits and fast close
- Robust Accounting knowledge under US-GAAP, French GAAP and French tax
- Strong working knowledge of the purchase-to-pay cycle
- High integrity and work ethic
- Willingness to travel when necessary
- Ability to work autonomously and well in teams
- Strong Excel and accounting software skills
- Fluent in English and French
- Strong communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills
- Willingness to extend themselves and assist other people


Nice-to-haves
- Knowledge of Netsuite
- Experience in global companies with remote HQ
- Strong desire to contribute to growing the company
- Strong commercial awareness
- Flexible with an ability to manage in a matrix/ diverse environmentUnderstanding of how to set up new processes and ways of working
- Experience in start-up companies with ability to grow
- A hands-on challenge seeker
- Experience in software or technology companies  
  
  
**CV's must be sent in English.** 

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative - Sydney
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We are looking for a results-driven and hands-on Sales Development Representative to manage Dataiku's inbound business development activities. Located in Sydney, your role will be to identify and qualify new sales opportunities to grow Dataiku sales for the Australian market. You must have the ability to understand the sales development process and technology stack and ensure its adoption. We need a self-starter motivated to constantly improve and optimize the process to drive performance.


Responsibilities
- Manage a large volume of daily **inbound**   **leads** - connecting via phone, email and Linkedin and qualifying them 
- Engage with our Sales and Marketing executives to design, research and execute outbound vertical and/or geographical markets campaigns to grow sales pipeline in a dedicated territory 
- Work with our Sales Executives to prospect large enterprise deals 
- Educate and nurture early-phase prospects for potential future opportunities
- Demonstrate knowledge of Dataiku DSS and its value proposition and an understanding of the Big Data ecosystem 
- Converse with data and business leaders from SMB to high-growth companies to large Fortune 1000 enterprises in industries such as e-commerce, retail, bank, insurance, utilities, and transport 
- Analyze and report on your weekly activities to identify potential optimizations 


Requirements
- Strong interpersonal skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills
- Organizational and project management skills with the ability to handle pressure and a high volume of tasks in a result-oriented environment
- Analytical skill and ability to understand the need to track everything you do
- Relevant experience and proven success in sales or business development in the software / tech industry or in a startup would be great, but it's not necessary
- Interest in innovative technologies like Big Data and Predictive Analysis
  


Benefits
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness





To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Sales Engineer - Denver
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for an experienced data science specialist to join as a Sales Engineer based in Denver, supporting our growth in the West Coast. We’re looking for someone who can express passion about data science, and communicate this passion to our customers. This role consists in supporting Dataiku’s presales efforts along the following three categories: 

Building Interest in Dataiku 
• Positioning the value of our technology in front of prospective clients 
• Building and delivering demonstrations of the project, on data and use cases relevant to the prospect, and to their specific circumstances 

Building Solutions in Dataiku
Sales Engineers are the primary builders of solutions that match the customer’s needs with the capabilities of our technology, which require...
• Knowledge of adjacent technologies in the Big Data and Analytics space
• Knowledge of competing analytics and data science platforms and their respective strengths and weaknesses
• The ability to communicate the capabilities of Dataiku's technology in great depth 
• Skill at conveying the value at which Dataiku's technology has delivered to other customers through in-depth knowledge of use cases and user stories

Building Evaluations of Dataiku
The Sales Engineer supports prospective clients that wish to evaluate our technology by...
• Structuring evaluations by identifying the core capabilities that need to be tested, and defining the most efficient way for them to be tested 
• Building the evaluation project plan, with detailed timelines and responsibilities 
• Marshaling the necessary resources from within Dataiku and the client organization in order to ensure that the evaluation progresses efficiently 
• Monitoring and ensuring that the evaluation goes to plan, and addressing any issues that may come up during the evaluation  

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this phase of very rapid growth, the Sales Engineer is likely to work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Product Management, and Engineering.




Responsibilities:
- Work with multiple Account Executives & partners to support opportunity qualification process 
- Direct presentations to prospective customers and partners using knowledge of industry trends and standards and common industry challenges coupled with Dataiku solution knowledge 
- Prepare the technical responses during the RFP and RFI process
- Drive the process of delivering high-quality product and architecture presentations and demonstrations
- Configure the Dataiku product and demonstrate advanced product concepts 
- Train partners and customers on products and features and assist in implementation of the product. 
- Customize and present Customer Presentations for every Customer/Industry/Role 
- Ensure to follow up on problems and process independently related to solutions engineering whatever in pre-sale or implementation capacity ensuring excellent customer experience. 
- Lead validation and implementation of technical requirements with customers ensuring smooth deployment of solution, working with the R&D & Operations. Assist account teams in ensuring customer satisfaction
- Represent Dataiku as a general industry Subject Matter Expert Travel to customer sites across Canada


Requirements:
- 3+ years direct experience in Data Science and Analytics 
- Experience in complex / large-scale enterprise analytics deployment 
- Experience in Python and/or R
- Familiarity with data storage and computing infrastructure for data of all sizes (SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Spark, on-premise, and cloud) 
- Knowledge of machine learning libraries and techniques
- Experience with visualization and dashboarding solutions 
- Great communication and public speaking skills 
- Ability to promote our software through smart blog posts, meet-ups and speaker engagements 
- Ability to travel 10 to 40%


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

• Building the evaluation project plan, with detailed timelines and responsibilities
• Marshaling the necessary resources from within Dataiku and the client organization in order to ensure that the evaluation progresses efficiently
• Monitoring and ensuring that the evaluation goes to plan, and addressing any issues that may come up during the evaluation

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this phase of very rapid growth, the Sales Engineer is likely to work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Product Management, and Engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with multiple Account Executives & partners to support opportunity qualification process
  • Direct presentations to prospective customers and partners using knowledge of industry trends and standards and common industry challenges coupled with Dataiku solution knowledge
  • Prepare the technical responses during the RFP and RFI process
  • Drive the process of delivering high-quality product and architecture presentations and demonstrations
  • Configure the Dataiku product and demonstrate advanced product concepts
  • Train partners and customers on products and features and assist in implementation of the product.
  • Customize and present Customer Presentations for every Customer/Industry/Role
  • Ensure to follow up on problems and process independently related to solutions engineering whatever in pre-sale or implementation capacity ensuring excellent customer experience.
  • Lead validation and implementation of technical requirements with customers ensuring smooth deployment of solution, working with the R&D & Operations. Assist account teams in ensuring customer satisfaction
  • Represent Dataiku as a general industry Subject Matter Expert Travel to customer sites across Canada

Requirements:

  • 3+ years direct experience in Data Science and Analytics
  • Experience in complex / large-scale enterprise analytics deployment
  • Experience in Python and/or R
  • Familiarity with data storage and computing infrastructure for data of all sizes (SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Spark, on-premise, and cloud)
  • Knowledge of machine learning libraries and techniques
  • Experience with visualization and dashboarding solutions
  • Great communication and public speaking skills
  • Ability to promote our software through smart blog posts, meet-ups and speaker engagements
  • Ability to travel 10 to 40%

Benefits:

  • Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
  • Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
  • Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
  • Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
  • Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!
