• Monitoring and ensuring that the evaluation goes to plan, and addressing any issues that may come up during the evaluation

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this phase of very rapid growth, the Sales Engineer is likely to work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, Product Management, and Engineering.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with multiple Account Executives & partners to support opportunity qualification process
  • Direct presentations to prospective customers and partners using knowledge of industry trends and standards and common industry challenges coupled with Dataiku solution knowledge
  • Prepare the technical responses during the RFP and RFI process
  • Drive the process of delivering high-quality product and architecture presentations and demonstrations
  • Configure the Dataiku product and demonstrate advanced product concepts
  • Train partners and customers on products and features and assist in implementation of the product.
  • Customize and present Customer Presentations for every Customer/Industry/Role
  • Ensure to follow up on problems and process independently related to solutions engineering whatever in pre-sale or implementation capacity ensuring excellent customer experience.
  • Lead validation and implementation of technical requirements with customers ensuring smooth deployment of solution, working with the R&D & Operations. Assist account teams in ensuring customer satisfaction
  • Represent Dataiku as a general industry Subject Matter Expert Travel to customer sites

Requirements:

  • 3+ years direct experience in Data Science and Analytics
  • Experience in complex / large-scale enterprise analytics deployment
  • Experience in Python and/or R
  • Familiarity with data storage and computing infrastructure for data of all sizes (SQL, NoSQL, Hadoop, Spark, on-premise, and cloud)
  • Knowledge of machine learning libraries and techniques
  • Experience with visualization and dashboarding solutions
  • Great communication and public speaking skills
  • Ability to promote our software through smart blog posts, meet-ups and speaker engagements
  • Ability to travel 10 to 40%

Benefits:

  • Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
  • Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
  • Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
  • Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
  • Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Senior Account Executive - Netherlands
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for an experienced Senior Account Executive to join our sales team in Amsterdam. Since the launch, we have experienced a strong product market fit and steady market demand. Thanks to our expanding business, we have created a new position for an individual to have responsibility for an extensive territory.

We’re looking for someone who can express passion about the new technologies and possibilities of Big Data and Advanced Analytics.

The role consists of engaging prospects and customers on the topic of their Big Data and Advanced Analytics initiatives and to help them develop a more efficient approach, leveraging our platform. The Account Executive is responsible for the entire sales cycle, with the goal of delivering a successful partnership with the prospect, by leveraging various company resources, to reach a successful collaboration with the prospect.

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this early stage, the Account Executive is likely to work cross functionally with Marketing, Product Management and Engineering.


Requirements
- 5+ years experience in software field sales
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills in  **Dutch** , and in **English **
- Strong belief in a customer centric selling philosophy and applying a consultative approach in customer interactions
- Background in selling innovation and new concepts to large Enterprises
- Strong ability to develop a vision match with prospects and customers, to develop alignment across different groups and cultivate champions.
- Good articulation of competitive positioning
- Travel 10 to 20%
  
**Desired Skills** - Experience in ‘data’ – big data, analytics, data science, BI/DW, data integration
- Early-stage start-up experience



  


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Senior Account Executive - Switzerland
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for an experienced Senior Account Executive to join our EU sales team in either Zurich, Basel or remotely to focus on the Switzerland region. In addition to strong product-market fit, the territory benefits from extensive marketing and sales exposure over the past months with significant latent demand.

The role consists of engaging prospects and customers on the topic of their Big Data and Advanced Analytics initiatives and to help them develop a more efficient approach, leveraging Dataiku DSS. The Account Executive is responsible for the entire sales cycle, leveraging various company resources, to reach a successful collaboration with the prospect.

Dataiku is a young company with great momentum and at this early stage, the Account Executive is likely to work cross-functionally with Marketing, Product Management and Engineering, and will be a key player in defining Dataiku's European strategy. We’re looking for someone who can express passion about the new technologies and possibilities of Big Data and Advanced Analytics.


Requirements
- You have strong interpersonal skills and excellent verbal and written communication skills in **French** , **English and German (mandatory)**. 
- Demonstrable experience in technical field sales
- Strong belief in a customer-centric selling philosophy and applying a consultative approach in customer interactions
- Background in selling innovation and new concepts to large Enterprises
- Strong ability to develop a vision match with prospects and customers, to develop alignment across different groups and cultivate champions
- Good articulation of competitive positioning
- Travel 10 to 40%
  
**Desired Skills** - "Data" experience – big data, analytics, data science, machine learning, BI/DW, data integration
- Early-stage start-up experience


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Senior Manager - London
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for an Senior Manager to lead client engagements as part of Dataiku’s new Strategic Advisory practice. 

This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a new strategic area within a highly successful Unicorn. As Dataiku’s Global Business Consulting unit, the Strategic Advisory practice will work with our global blue chip client base to provide organisational and technological recommendations, focused on cutting edge Business Analytics and AI topics, across a wide range of sectors, including healthcare, IT, financial services, media, industrials, business services and many others.


In this new role, you will help the team to:
- Deliver organisational and strategic recommendations for large organisations worldwide on the topics of AI and business analytics, leading project teams and collaborating with internal contributors whose specific expertise can be leveraged.
- Define a strategy for clients on their analytics journey and support them and the rest of the Dataiku’s teams to implement it
- Build out the capabilities of the Strategic Advisory team, and coaching junior consultants
- Support the development and standardisation of our in-house toolkit & methodologies


For this position, you are the right candidate for Dataiku if:
- You have a strong background (min 6 years or 3 years post MBA) in either strategic or management consulting (e.g. Bain, BCG, McKinsey, A.T. Kearney, Oliver Wyman, Strategy&, Parthenon, OC&C, LEK, Accenture, Capgemini), including leading engagement and more junior consultants
- You have knowledge of analytics and transformational projects
- You have experience in leading client engagements with very large organisations
- You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Responsibilities:
- Modify the existing Dataiku DSS software source code to correct errors and bugs, to improve its performance, or to add new features by preparing an initial solution and after testing it pass on to the R&D team. 
- Analyze user needs, customer requests and formulate software requirements to analyze the feasibility of designing those features within resource constraints. 
- Store, retrieve, and prepare data for analysis and use that data to design required machine learning software to setup different processes and tools to empower various functions within Dataiku. 
- Design, develop and modify complex software systems, Plugins and Web Apps using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes in various domains across different teams in Dataiku. 
- Coordinate software system installation and design software for Dataiku DSS to monitor usage of the software, ensuring specifications are met and report any issues by gathering feedback from the system. 
- Consult with clients about Dataiku DSS software system design improvement and maintenance. 


Requirements:
- Bachelor’s degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering or related field.


Benefits:
- Opportunity to contribute to the core vision of our company and product: simplify and democratize the way people work with data and use Artificial Intelligence
- Exposure to the latest, open source technologies that Dataiku integrates. See our release notes for our latest developments: [https://doc.dataiku.com/dss/latest/release_notes/index.html](https://doc.dataiku.com/dss/latest/release_notes/index.html)
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ) and other locations worldwide for company-wide and team summits
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team in hypergrowth mode
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Transparency, Ambition, Excellence, Humility, and Empathy


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

  • Opportunity to contribute to the core vision of our company and product: simplify and democratize the way people work with data and use Artificial Intelligence
  • Exposure to the latest, open source technologies that Dataiku integrates. See our release notes for our latest developments: https://doc.dataiku.com/dss/latest/release_notes/index.html
  • Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
  • Trips to Paris (our European HQ) and other locations worldwide for company-wide and team summits
  • Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team in hypergrowth mode
  • Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Transparency, Ambition, Excellence, Humility, and Empathy

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Software Engineer in Test
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

We are looking for an outstanding software test engineer.

Our R&D team creates Dataiku DSS, a cutting-edge product that allows data analysts to discover hidden insights. As a software engineer in test, your mission will be to ensure that we only deliver highest-quality products to our customers. You will play a crucial role in our success by helping our users have the best possible experience.

DSS is built on modern Web technologies (single page webapp with Angular/AngularJS) and integrates with a very large ecosystem of big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, MPP databases, Cloud services, ...) . Our software testing stack includes developer-led unit tests, automated backend integration testing, automated browser-side testing and some manual frontend testing.

At Dataiku, developers are involved in writing part of the automated integration tests together with the QA team.


As a software engineer in test, your responsibilities will include:
- Working on advanced automated test suites to exercice our applications at all levels
- Writing tests following guidelines based on previous bugs
- Defining manual testing plans
- Working with the developers to ensure that they deliver testable code
- Use existing test infrastructure and frameworks (virtual machines, containers, auto-provisioning, UI testing, ...)


You are the ideal recruit if:
- You have a passion for quality and a good attention to details
- You are not scared about technical challenges and technologies diversity
- You have a first experience working on automated testing of an end-to-end application
- You know that Selenium is not only the name of the 34th element
- Experience with testing single-page web applications is a big plus, as is experience with big data technologies
- You are not afraid of proposing new things


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Solutions Architect - West Coast
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation. 

Dataiku is looking for an experienced Solutions Architect to join its Technology Alliances team, to primarily cover North America and based in the West United States. We’re looking for someone who can express passion about data science, and communicate this passion to our strategic technology alliance partners.  

This role consists of supporting Dataiku’s Technology Alliances efforts in the following three main categories: 

Act as a trusted adviser between Dataiku and our technology alliance partners, bridging the gap between leadership, field sales, product management, engineering and technical delivery in order to define business-focused consulting, technology-integration and OEM solutions. 

Support joint sales activities as the domain expert for cloud & ecosystem services with regard to Data Science, Machine Learning and AI-based solutions. 

Provide enablement to external alliance teams on Dataiku, and to internal teams on cloud & ecosystem technologies, through the creation and delivery of presentations, workshops, demo environments and other materials.


Responsibilities:
- Provide technical leadership in a pre-sales and post-sales capacity for customers to support successful understanding, evaluation and adoption of Dataiku in conjunction with our alliance partners’ technologies.
- Work with Dataiku and technology alliance Enterprise Architects, Solutions Architects, alliance, product management and global field sales teams to plan, design and develop joint AI-focused solutions across industries.
- Consult on architecture and design, bootstrap and/or implement strategic customer projects to ensure success at an account level.
- Deliver strategy & roadmap support for joint sales activities at the account level.
- Shorten joint sales cycles by supporting key sales activities at the opportunity level.
- Ensure adoption and integration into partners selling motion to drive land and expand.
- Act as a bridge between partner teams and Dataiku-internal Product Management and R&D for planning, support and escalation management.
- Develop and deliver enablement on the joint value proposition and joint solutions to Dataiku-internal field sales teams.
- Build reference architectures, how-to’s, and demo applications for customers.
- Provide escalated level of support for critical customer operational issues.
- Architect, implement, and/or validate integrations with 3rd party applications.
- Evangelize Dataiku & technology alliance partners across developer communities through meetups and conferences.
- Be a Dataiku + cloud expert.


Requirements:
- 3+ years of experience working with at least 1 of the major cloud providers to design, build and deploy data-focused solutions (as a Solutions Architect or similar role).
- Experience working with SQL databases, Hadoop, data cataloging and visualisation products to design, build and deploy data-focused solutions.
- Ability to think strategically, go deep technologically and work flexibly to achieve results.
- Experience developing product integrations and managing the end-to-end integration process from ideation to development, marketing, field roll-out, and sales support globally.
- Strong ability to network, align and work with key players at all levels to drive results.
- Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
- Excellent presentation and whiteboarding skills.
- Ability to provide guidance via technical content- blogs, whitepapers, patterns etc.
- Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.
- Ideally: Relevant cloud certifications.
- Ideally: Experience working with Data Science / Machine Learning solutions.
- Ideally: An experienced practitioner of a Data Science / Machine Learning programming language such as Python or R.


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
- Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

  • Shorten joint sales cycles by supporting key sales activities at the opportunity level.
  • Ensure adoption and integration into partners selling motion to drive land and expand.
  • Act as a bridge between partner teams and Dataiku-internal Product Management and R&D for planning, support and escalation management.
  • Develop and deliver enablement on the joint value proposition and joint solutions to Dataiku-internal field sales teams.
  • Build reference architectures, how-to’s, and demo applications for customers.
  • Provide escalated level of support for critical customer operational issues.
  • Architect, implement, and/or validate integrations with 3rd party applications.
  • Evangelize Dataiku & technology alliance partners across developer communities through meetups and conferences.
  • Be a Dataiku + cloud expert.

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience working with at least 1 of the major cloud providers to design, build and deploy data-focused solutions (as a Solutions Architect or similar role).
  • Experience working with SQL databases, Hadoop, data cataloging and visualisation products to design, build and deploy data-focused solutions.
  • Ability to think strategically, go deep technologically and work flexibly to achieve results.
  • Experience developing product integrations and managing the end-to-end integration process from ideation to development, marketing, field roll-out, and sales support globally.
  • Strong ability to network, align and work with key players at all levels to drive results.
  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
  • Excellent presentation and whiteboarding skills.
  • Ability to provide guidance via technical content- blogs, whitepapers, patterns etc.
  • Ability to travel up to 25% of the time.
  • Ideally: Relevant cloud certifications.
  • Ideally: Experience working with Data Science / Machine Learning solutions.
  • Ideally: An experienced practitioner of a Data Science / Machine Learning programming language such as Python or R.

Benefits:

  • Opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale the company
  • Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
  • Trips to Paris (our European HQ)
  • Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate and driven team
  • Dataiku has a strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Solutions Architect - West Coast
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.  
  
  
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.   
Dataiku is looking for an experienced Solutions Architect to join its Technology Alliances team, to primarily cover North America and based in the West United States. We’re looking for someone who can express passion about data science, and communicate this passion to our strategic technology alliance partners.    
This role consists of supporting Dataiku’s Technology Alliances efforts in the following three main categories:   
**Act as a trusted adviser** between Dataiku and our technology alliance partners, bridging the gap between leadership, field sales, product management, engineering and technical delivery in order to define business-focused consulting, technology-integration and OEM solutions.   
**Support joint sales activities** as the domain expert for cloud & ecosystem services with regard to Data Science, Machine Learning and AI-based solutions.   
**Provide enablement** to external alliance teams on Dataiku, and to internal teams on cloud & ecosystem technologies, through the creation and delivery of presentations, workshops, demo environments and other materials.

jobs.title: Technical Recruiter
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

As part of our growth, we are looking for a talented Technical Recruiter to join our Talent Acquisition team to help us primarily develop our R&D department, but also assist for other exciting opportunities! 

The recruiter will own all aspects of recruiting, including outreach, screening/interviewing, managing candidates, and acting as an advisor and trusted resource to hiring managers and interview teams. 


What You'll Do
- Engage talent — Identify the right people, get them engaged, and manage the full hiring process
- Build solid relationships with your hiring teams and serve as an advisor and partner to build healthy pipelines of stellar candidates and fill current openings
- Craft and enhance a consistent and extraordinary candidate experience
- Train hiring managers and interviewers to ensure a great experience to our candidates
- Work with Talent Team in developing Talent Acquisition strategies and projects
- Be a passionate Dataiku brand ambassador before, during, and after recruitment. You will help us build our talent brand in addition to our talent pipeline.


Who You Are
- 3+ years of experience in tech hiring with a passion for building high-performing tech teams 
- Deep understanding of the technical landscape and able to talk tech ; a technical experience or an engineering degree is a plus
- Resourceful in using creative tools to identify and attract high demand talent
- Experience collaborating with and influencing senior hiring managers and executives throughout the recruiting cycle
- Ability to work independently and simultaneously on multiple positions
- Demonstrable experience recruiting for a fast-paced company, ideally for a software company
- Knowledge of ATS tools (Lever is a plus) and recruiting technologies





To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.  
  
  
Dataiku is looking for an experienced Technical Support engineer to join its rapidly growing international team (with members distributed across the US, EMEA, and APAC regions). The ideal candidate is an autonomous individual who is passionate about getting big data and data science technologies working together to solve business problems, and who will efficiently help customers solve their technical issues with Dataiku DSS. It is a great opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale that critical function for the company.  
As a Technical Support Engineer, you are a polished communicator and a trusted technical resource. You have worked with sophisticated/demanding customers, and you demonstrate excellent judgment in prioritization and are a multi-tasker. You love learning new cutting-edge technologies and getting your hands dirty to solve challenging technical problems. You are naturally driven to become the expert in the space.

jobs.title: Technical Support Engineer (Federal)
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for an experienced Technical Support engineer to join its rapidly growing international team (with members distributed across the US, EMEA, and APAC regions). It is a great opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale that critical function for the company.

As a Technical Support Engineer, you are a polished communicator and a trusted technical resource. You have worked with sophisticated/demanding customers, and you demonstrate excellent judgment in prioritization and are a multi-tasker. You love learning new cutting-edge technologies and getting your hands dirty to solve challenging technical problems. You are naturally driven to become the expert in the space.

We are looking for someone in the US to help with providing world-class support to our Federal customer base. In particular, this position will require the individual to be either a US citizen or qualified green card holder. Clearance is not necessary but would be a plus. 


Responsibilities:
- Providing technical solutions and responding to technical requests from customers through our different channels: email, chat, web conference, and support portal
- Managing and resolving support issues with a high degree of technical complexity
- Acting as a liaison between clients and other Dataiku teams (Customer Success, Engineering, Data Science, etc.) to help deliver a fast and efficient resolution to issues or questions raised from various customers
- Improve efficiencies by documenting and standardizing support processes for our customers along with capturing/developing best practices 
- Developing tools that will help in diagnosing, resolving or triaging hard-to-get-at problems as efficiently and promptly as possible
- Documenting knowledge in the form of incident notes, technical articles, and contributions to knowledge base or forums within specific areas of expertise
- Timely follow-up on customer commitments, effectively prioritizing process / product refinements; relaying lessons learned and feedback internally to our other client-facing and technical teams
- Providing support to some of our largest, most challenging Federal and Enterprise accounts


Requirements:
- BS in an Engineering or advanced analytics field, or equivalent practical experience
- A strong competency in technical problem solving, with experience in working with advanced log analysis and various debugging techniques
- Working proficiency with Unix-based operating systems and general systems administration knowledge (i.e. command line interface, SSH, handling permissions, file limits, networking, resource utilization, etc.)
- Experience working with a programming language
- Experience working with at least one type of relational databases and SQL
- Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with an aptitude for learning new technologies
- Ability to be autonomous, resourceful, and a proactive self-starter, while also remaining process-oriented and a team player
- Strong communication skills and the ability to interface with both technical and non-technical individuals as needed
- **US citizen or green card holder**


Bonus Points:
- At least 3-5 years of experience minimum in a client-facing engineering or technical role, ideally involving a complex and rapidly evolving software/product
- Technical understanding of the analytics and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, SQL databases and Data Warehouses) is a definite plus
- Prior experience with and demonstrated interest in staying up to date on the latest data technologies (Python, R, Hadoop, Jupyter notebooks, Spark, H2O, Docker/Kubernetes, etc.)
- Hands-on experience with Python and/or R
- Experience working with various APIs
- Experience with authentication and authorization systems like LDAP, SAML, and Kerberos
- Working knowledge of various cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.)
- Some knowledge in data science and/or machine learning
- Experience or proven track record working with Federal clients


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku at an early stage and help scale the Support organization
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to our different offices (Paris, NYC, etc.)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate, and driven team
- Startup atmosphere: Free foods and drinks, foosball/FIFA/ping pong, company happy hours and team days, and more
- Strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

- A strong competency in technical problem solving, with experience in working with advanced log analysis and various debugging techniques
- Working proficiency with Unix-based operating systems and general systems administration knowledge (i.e. command line interface, SSH, handling permissions, file limits, networking, resource utilization, etc.)
- Experience working with a programming language
- Experience working with at least one type of relational databases and SQL
- Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with an aptitude for learning new technologies
- Ability to be autonomous, resourceful, and a proactive self-starter, while also remaining process-oriented and a team player
- Strong communication skills and the ability to interface with both technical and non-technical individuals as needed
- **US citizen or green card holder**


Bonus Points:
- At least 3-5 years of experience minimum in a client-facing engineering or technical role, ideally involving a complex and rapidly evolving software/product
- Technical understanding of the analytics and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, SQL databases and Data Warehouses) is a definite plus
- Prior experience with and demonstrated interest in staying up to date on the latest data technologies (Python, R, Hadoop, Jupyter notebooks, Spark, H2O, Docker/Kubernetes, etc.)
- Hands-on experience with Python and/or R
- Experience working with various APIs
- Experience with authentication and authorization systems like LDAP, SAML, and Kerberos
- Working knowledge of various cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.)
- Some knowledge in data science and/or machine learning
- Experience or proven track record working with Federal clients


Benefits:
- Opportunity to join Dataiku at an early stage and help scale the Support organization
- Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
- Trips to our different offices (Paris, NYC, etc.)
- Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate, and driven team
- Startup atmosphere: Free foods and drinks, foosball/FIFA/ping pong, company happy hours and team days, and more
- Strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku is looking for an experienced Technical Support engineer to join its rapidly growing international team (with members distributed across the US, EMEA, and APAC regions). The ideal candidate is an autonomous individual who is passionate about getting big data and data science technologies working together to solve business problems, and who will efficiently help customers solve their technical issues with Dataiku DSS. It is a great opportunity to join Dataiku early on and help scale that critical function for the company.

As a Technical Support Engineer, you are a polished communicator and a trusted technical resource. You have worked with sophisticated/demanding customers, and you demonstrate excellent judgment in prioritization and are a multi-tasker. You love learning new cutting-edge technologies and getting your hands dirty to solve challenging technical problems. You are naturally driven to become the expert in the space.

We are looking for someone in the US to help with providing world-class support to our Federal customer base. In particular, this position will require the individual to be either a US citizen or qualified green card holder. Clearance is not necessary but would be a plus.

Responsibilities:

  • Providing technical solutions and responding to technical requests from customers through our different channels: email, chat, web conference, and support portal
  • Managing and resolving support issues with a high degree of technical complexity
  • Acting as a liaison between clients and other Dataiku teams (Customer Success, Engineering, Data Science, etc.) to help deliver a fast and efficient resolution to issues or questions raised from various customers
  • Improve efficiencies by documenting and standardizing support processes for our customers along with capturing/developing best practices
  • Developing tools that will help in diagnosing, resolving or triaging hard-to-get-at problems as efficiently and promptly as possible
  • Documenting knowledge in the form of incident notes, technical articles, and contributions to knowledge base or forums within specific areas of expertise
  • Timely follow-up on customer commitments, effectively prioritizing process / product refinements; relaying lessons learned and feedback internally to our other client-facing and technical teams
  • Providing support to some of our largest, most challenging Federal and Enterprise accounts

Requirements:

  • BS in an Engineering or advanced analytics field, or equivalent practical experience
  • A strong competency in technical problem solving, with experience in working with advanced log analysis and various debugging techniques
  • Working proficiency with Unix-based operating systems and general systems administration knowledge (i.e. command line interface, SSH, handling permissions, file limits, networking, resource utilization, etc.)
  • Experience working with a programming language
  • Experience working with at least one type of relational databases and SQL
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills with an aptitude for learning new technologies
  • Ability to be autonomous, resourceful, and a proactive self-starter, while also remaining process-oriented and a team player
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to interface with both technical and non-technical individuals as needed
  • US citizen or green card holder

Bonus Points:

  • At least 3-5 years of experience minimum in a client-facing engineering or technical role, ideally involving a complex and rapidly evolving software/product
  • Technical understanding of the analytics and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, SQL databases and Data Warehouses) is a definite plus
  • Prior experience with and demonstrated interest in staying up to date on the latest data technologies (Python, R, Hadoop, Jupyter notebooks, Spark, H2O, Docker/Kubernetes, etc.)
  • Hands-on experience with Python and/or R
  • Experience working with various APIs
  • Experience with authentication and authorization systems like LDAP, SAML, and Kerberos
  • Working knowledge of various cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc.)
  • Some knowledge in data science and/or machine learning
  • Experience or proven track record working with Federal clients

Benefits:

  • Opportunity to join Dataiku at an early stage and help scale the Support organization
  • Competitive compensation package, equity, health benefits, and paid vacation
  • Trips to our different offices (Paris, NYC, etc.)
  • Opportunity to work with a smart, passionate, and driven team
  • Startup atmosphere: Free foods and drinks, foosball/FIFA/ping pong, company happy hours and team days, and more
  • Strong culture based on key values: Ownership, Passion, Autonomy and Friendliness

To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!

jobs.title: Technology Alliances Manager - EMEA
jobs.description:
Dataiku’s mission is big: to enable all people throughout companies around the world to use data by removing friction surrounding data access, cleaning, modeling, deployment, and more. But it’s not just about technology and processes; at Dataiku, we also believe that people (including our people!) are a critical piece of the equation.

Dataiku’s mission is big: to help people in companies around the world get more out of their data. We want to remove the friction they experience in accessing, cleaning, and modeling data, deploying it, and more. But we’re not just about technology and processes. At Dataiku, we believe people -- including our own -- are critical to making our value proposition clear and compelling.

We are looking for a Technology Alliances Manager to join our Technology Alliances team. We need someone with a passion for data science, of course, but also someone who can help drive business with companies whose products complement ours in the ecosystem market. Dataiku succeeds when our customers can see we work well with other technologies and technology companies.

The Technology Alliances Manager will:

Build and promote our technology alliances through regular communications, driving joint solutions, and enabling both sales teams. Describing the alliance’s value to our audiences, internal and external, and helping promote Dataiku effectively to our alliance’s audience. 

Support joint sales and marketing activities. Connect Dataiku leadership, sales teams, customer champions, product managers, and marketers to their alliance peers. Help customers see that working with Dataiku and its alliances is greater than the sum of its parts. Promote integration solutions that drive business value. Identify and build joint customer success stories.

Drive business adoption. Show our alliances how DSS works. Inspire them to use it. Be ready to articulate the value of our product to alliance team members and trade show attendees. Write or co-author blogs, support regional GTM strategies, plan and deliver webinars, joint product launches, and other marketing events. 


Responsibilities
- Promote the adoption and use of Dataiku DSS as a powerful complement to our alliance partners’ technologies.
- Work with Dataiku and technology alliance team members and leadership, account executives, sales engineers, architects, product managers and others to promote and enable alliance-based solution selling.
- Develop skills and understanding in a new technology domain.
- Support strategic & roadmap initiatives for joint sales activities.
- Support and develop growth and opportunistic alliances.
- Serve as the liaison between alliance teams to coordinate joint customer planning and meetings.
- Deliver enablement collateral on joint value propositions and solutions to our field sales teams.
- Write and review blogs, webinars, and sales briefs.
- Evangelize Dataiku & our technology alliance partners at meetups, partner events, and trade show conferences.


Requirements
- You’ve worked with multiple ecosystem technologies, such as SQL databases, data visualization tools, big data platforms, analytics engines, data catalogs and other governance tools. Working knowledge of AWS, Microsoft Azure or GCP is a big advantage.
- You can translate a product integration feature into a business value proposition that a team member, alliance partner, or customer can understand.
- You are familiar with common technical product integration strategies. You can outline an end-to-end integration process and define a go-to-market plan.
- You have a natural ability to network with other people. You have a knack for cooperative and collaborative work, in person or remotely, while driving results.
- You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
- You can develop and review both sales enablement and marketing content: blogs, whitepapers, solution briefs, success stories, sales decks.
- You can travel up to 25% of the time.
- Ideal: you worked with Data Science / Machine Learning tools/frameworks.
- Ideal: You’ve used Python or R to complete a data science or ML project (and can explain what you did).


To fulfill its mission, Dataiku is growing fast! In 2019, we achieved unicorn status, went from 200 to 400 people and opened new offices across the globe. We now serve our global customer base from our headquarters in New York City as well as offices in Paris, London, Munich, Amsterdam, Denver, Los Angeles, Singapore, Sydney and Dubaï. Each of them has a unique culture, but underpinning local nuances, we always value curiosity, collaboration, and can-do attitudes!
